alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Miami; Pulaski (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 9:07AM EDT until May 14 at 1:14AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Indiana, including the following counties, Cass IN, Fulton IN, Miami and Pulaski. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 901 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated rain moving out of the advisory area, however, significant rainfall amounts of 4 to 6 inches will continue to cause runoff that will extend flooding of roads and low-lying areas into the early afternoon.Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. The heaviest rain fell in and just southeast of the city of Fulton. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. Any additional rain will serve to extend ongoing minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kewanna, Denver, Fulton, Macy, Nyena Lake, Marshtown, Fletcher, Grass Creek, Deedsville and Chili. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
